definition: suddenly have a thought (idiom)/suddenly be inspired to do something
to dash/to move forward quickly/to bulge/to protrude/to break through/to rush out/sudden/Taiwan pr. [tu2]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

sentences.english: His latest novel came to him while sitting in traffic in Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 他最新的小说是在坐车时突发奇想，灵光闪现。

sentences.english: On a whim, he called a manager he knew.
sentences.chinese: 他突发奇想，给那里一个认识的经理打了电话。

sentences.english: I often dance around the house on a whim.
sentences.chinese: 我常常突发奇想，在房子里舞蹈。

definition: to be prompted by a sudden impulse/carried away by a whim/to have a brainstorm
a bright idea suddenly occurs (idiom); to hit upon an inspiration/to be struck by a brainwave
at leisure/idle/to have nothing to do
imaginative/to have one's mind buzzing with ideas
to burgeon/to produce/to conceive/to be in the initial stage
to figure out/to work out (a solution etc)/to think up/to come up with (an idea etc)
demons and gods at work (idiom); unexplained event crying out for a supernatural explanation/curious coincidence
